content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the code for your request in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s) # Split string into words
    
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line*word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            line = ""
        end
        
        line *= " " * word
    end
    
    return result * line # Add the remaining part of the sentence to the final result
end

# Example usage: 
println(wrap_string("Hello, how are you doing today? I hope everything is going well for you."))
```
In this code, `split(s)` function splits the string into words. The loop iterates over each word and checks if adding the current word to the existing line would cause it to exceed the maximum width. If so, a new line is started. Finally, all lines are concatenated together with `\n` for new lines at the end of each one.
